intro: Marrubium turkeviczii, commonly known as Turkish horehound, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has a strong, aromatic scent and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within its native habitat.
